I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
num_Clients: nat

Goal:
forall (sigma : name -> data) (st' : Data) (x : Client_index), locks_correct sigma -> held st' = false -> locks_correct (update name_eq_dec sigma (Client x) st')

Premises:
data = fun BaseParams0 : BaseParams => let (data, _, _) := BaseParams0 in data : BaseParams -> Type Arguments data {BaseParams}
update : (forall x y : ?A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> (?A -> ?B) -> ?A -> ?B -> ?A -> ?B where ?A : [num_Clients : nat |- Type] ?B : [num_Clients : nat |- Type]
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
name_eq_dec : forall x y : name, {x = y} + {x <> y}
Inductive Name : Type := Client : Client_index -> Name | Server : Name
held = fun d : Data => let (_, held) := d in held : Data -> bool
Client_index = fin num_Clients : Type
locks_correct = fun sigma : name -> data => forall n : Client_index, held (sigma (Client n)) = true -> exists t : list Client_index, queue (sigma Server) = n :: t : (name -> data) -> Prop Arguments locks_correct _%function_scope
name = fun (P : BaseParams) (MultiParams0 : MultiParams P) => let (name, msg, _, _, nodes, _, _, _, _, _) := MultiParams0 in name : forall P : BaseParams, MultiParams P -> Type Arguments name {P MultiParams}
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Record Data : Type := mkData { queue : list Client_index; held : bool } Arguments mkData _%list_scope _%bool_scope
locks_correct_implies_mutex : forall sigma : name -> data, locks_correct sigma -> mutual_exclusion sigma
Record Decomposition (B : BaseParams) (M : MultiParams B) : Type := Build_Decomposition { state_invariant : (name -> data) -> Prop; network_invariant : (name -> data) -> packet -> Prop; network_network_invariant : packet -> packet -> Prop; network_network_invariant_sym : forall p1 p2 : packet, network_network_invariant p1 p2 -> network_network_invariant p2 p1; state_invariant_init : state_invariant init_handlers; state_invariant_maintained_input : forall (h : name) (inp : input) (sigma : name -> data) (st' : data) (out : list output) (ps : list (name * msg)), input_handlers h inp (sigma h) = (out, st', ps) ->...-> distinct_pairs_and network_network_invariant (map (fun m : name * msg => {| pSrc := pDst p; pDst := fst m; pBody := snd m |}) ps) } Arguments Build_Decomposition _ _ (_ _ _ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
mutual_exclusion = fun sigma : name -> data => forall m n : Client_index, held (sigma (Client m)) = true -> held (sigma (Client n)) = true -> m = n : (name -> data) -> Prop Arguments mutual_exclusion _%function_scope
Build_Decomposition : forall (B : BaseParams) (M : MultiParams B) (state_invariant : (name -> data) -> Prop) (network_invariant : (name -> data) -> packet -> Prop) (network_network_invariant : packet -> packet -> Prop), (forall p1 p2 : packet, network_network_invariant p1 p2 -> network_network_invariant p2 p1) -> state_invariant init_handlers -> (forall (h : name) (inp : input) (sigma : name -> data) (st' : data) (out : list output) (ps : list (name * msg)), input_handlers h inp (sigma h) = (out, st', ps) -> state_invariant sigma -> state_invariant (update name_eq_dec sigma h st')) ->...-> Decomposition B M

update_nop : forall (A B : Type) (A_eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (sigma : A -> B) (x y : A), update A_eq_dec sigma x (sigma x) y = sigma y
locks_correct_init = fun (n : Client_index) (H : false = true) => let H0 : False := eq_ind false (fun e : bool => if e then False else True) I true H in False_ind (exists t : list Client_index, [] = n :: t) H0 : locks_correct init_handlers Expanded type for implicit arguments locks_correct_init : forall n : Client_index, held (init_handlers (Client n)) = true -> exists t : list Client_index, queue (init_handlers Server) = n :: t Arguments locks_correct_init [n]

update_same : forall (A B : Type) (A_eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (sigma : A -> B) (x : A) (v : B), update A_eq_dec sigma x v x = v
LockServ_network_invariant = fun (sigma : name -> data) (p : packet) => locks_correct_unlock sigma p /\ locks_correct_locked sigma p : (name -> data) -> packet -> Prop Arguments LockServ_network_invariant _%function_scope

ServerNetHandler = fun (src : Name) (m : Msg) => st <- get;; (let q := queue st in match m with | Lock => match src with | Client c => (when (null q) (send (src, Locked));; put {| queue := q ++ [c]; held := held st |});; ret (MsgLock c) | Server => ret Nop end | Unlock => match q with | _ :: x :: xs => put {| queue := x :: xs; held := held st |};; send (Client x, Locked) | _ => put {| queue := []; held := held st |} end;; ret MsgUnlock | Locked => ret Nop end) : Name -> Msg -> Handler Data

```intros sigma st' x locks_corr held_false. unfold locks_correct. intros n Held. destruct (name_eq_dec (Client n) (Client x)) as [eq|neq].
+ rewrite eq. rewrite update_eq. assumption.
+ rewrite update_diff.
  * apply locks_corr. apply Held.
  * intros contra. apply neq. inversion contra. reflexivity.
```

original: intros sigma st' x locks_corr held_false. unfold locks_correct. intros n Held. destruct (name_eq_dec (Client n) (Client x)) as [eq|neq]. + rewrite eq. rewrite update_eq. auto. + rewrite update_diff. * apply locks_corr. apply Held. * intros contra. apply neq. inversion contra. reflexivity.
